commit_message:
Add weblate_utils.py to work with Weblate REST API

Rewrites existing ZanataUtils.py to work with Weblate as part of migration work.

Key summary:
- IniConfig class name is the same
- ZanataRestService class name is renamed as WeblateRestService class
  with the same functionality
- ProjectConfig class is not implemented since Weblate does not
  have project configuration file like zanata.xml.

Implements: blueprint weblate-tools
Change-Id: Ie4cf861cc6ca59456c5d563d7673fbf54b3bb42f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/i18n refs/changes/08/896308/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import json import requests from urllib.parse import urljoin import wlc import wlc.config as cfg class IniConfig(object): """Object that stores weblate.ini configuration Read url and key from weblate.ini and make its values available. Attributes: inifile: The path to the ini file to load values from. """ def __init__(self, inifile): self.inifile = inifile self._find_config() def _find_config(self): config = cfg.WeblateConfig() config.load(self.inifile) self.url, self.key = config.get_url_key() class WeblateRestService(object): """Object that communicates with the Weblate REST API. Attributes: url: The URL of the Weblate server. key: The API key to use for authentication. headers: The HTTP headers to use for requests. Must contain the key. verify: Whether to verify SSL certificates. """ def __init__(self, wconfig, accept='application/json, text/javascript', content_type='application/json', verify=True): self.url, self.key = wconfig.url, wconfig.key self.weblate_obj = wlc.Weblate() self.headers = {'Accept': accept, 'Content-Type': content_type, 'Authorization': 'Token ' + self.key} self.verify = verify def _construct_url(self, url_fragment): return urljoin(self.url, url_fragment) def query(self, url_fragment, raise_errors=True): request_url = self._construct_url(url_fragment) try: r = requests.get(request_url, verify=self.verify, headers=self.headers) except requests.exceptions.ConnectionError: raise ValueError('Connection Error') if raise_errors and r.status_code != 200: raise ValueError('Got status code %s for %s' % (r.status_code, request_url)) if raise_errors and not r.content: raise ValueError('Did not receive any data from %s' % request_url) return r def push(self, url_fragment, data): request_url = self._construct_url(url_fragment) try: return requests.put(request_url, verify=self.verify, headers=self.headers, data=json.dumps(data)) except requests.exceptions.ConnectionError: raise ValueError('Connection error')

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/2023.2

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/2023.2 branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I7411468390bfef42846df0bc90667cfc4c2a952b

commit_message:
Disable GSSAPIAuthentication for SSH

This implements STIG V-204598 [1] and disables
GSSAPIAuthentication that is enabled by default on EL
systems.
This also should speedup deployments on such systems, as
enabled GSSAPIAuthentication requires some time while
initiating connection.

[1] https://www.stigviewer.com/stig/red_hat_enterprise_linux_7/2020-12-08/finding/V-204598

Change-Id: I2d92541ccfc27e91224fd481c3792993428a052e
(cherry picked from commit abfa76ba93e52c97fe286253845e81f0291e9416)

commit_message:
Remove disable-selinux from default DIB elements

Change-Id: I7ef0c5240585bfdc27fbdf6b32edd5b51ce2d147
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kayobe refs/changes/66/897866/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: List of default DIB elements. Default is ``["enable-serial-console", "vm"]``. The ``vm`` element is poorly named, and causes DIB to build a whole disk image rather than a single partition.
deleted_lines: List of default DIB elements. Default is ``["disable-selinux", "enable-serial-console", "vm"]`` when ``os_distribution`` is ``centos`` or ``rocky``, ``["enable-serial-console", "vm"]`` otherwise. The ``vm`` element is poorly named, and causes DIB to build a whole disk image rather than a single partition.

subject: Enable NEUTRON_ENFORCE_SCOPE to True by default
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-10-25 19:58:06.000000000', 'files': ['lib/neutron'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/bacb8400942b2ed6b724bdd3d28797896e1054c6', 'message': 'Enable NEUTRON_ENFORCE_SCOPE to True by default

Neutron bobcat release has enabled the RBAC new defaults
by default. With the latest release of Neutron have new
defaults enable, we should configure the same by default in
devstack. This change make NEUTRON_ENFORCE_SCOPE flag to
True by default so that every job will run with Neutron
new defaults.

As old defaults are still supported (in deprecated way),

Change-Id: I3361d33885b2e3af7cad0141f9b799b2723ee8a1

commit_message:
Enable NEUTRON_ENFORCE_SCOPE to True by default

Neutron bobcat release has enabled the RBAC new defaults
by default. With the latest release of Neutron have new
defaults enable, we should configure the same by default in
devstack. This change make NEUTRON_ENFORCE_SCOPE flag to
True by default so that every job will run with Neutron
new defaults.

As old defaults are still supported (in deprecated way),
we will keep this flag so that we can have one job disable
it and test the old defaults.

Change-Id: I3361d33885b2e3af7cad0141f9b799b2723ee8a1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/06/899306/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # of the new RBAC policies and scopes. Set it to False if you do not # want to run Neutron with new RBAC. NEUTRON_ENFORCE_SCOPE=$(trueorfalse True NEUTRON_ENFORCE_SCOPE)
deleted_lines: # of the new RBAC policies and scopes. NEUTRON_ENFORCE_SCOPE=$(trueorfalse False NEUTRON_ENFORCE_SCOPE)

commit_message:
[Pure Storage] Fix connection issue on network failure.

Retry the login process if a network issue has caused the connection to
the FlashBlade to fail.

Use the periodic task to update share stats to catch this.

Closes-bug: #2032681
Change-Id: Ic4be90aba729978e24bdd808ba1130d05aed9985
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/95/892795/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | Pure Storage FlashBlade driver: Retry login for periodic task should network issue cause loss of connection. See `launchpad bug 2032681 <https://bugs.launchpad.net/manila/+bug/2032681>`_ for more details.

commit_message:
Revert "Add upgrade check for compute-object-ids linkage"

This is being reverted because it's overly strict and complaining
that upgrade-related work has not been done before it should have or
needs to have been done. This may be re-added later when we start
depending on these linkages.

Closes-Bug: #2039597
This reverts commit 27f384b7ac4f19ffaf884d77484814a220b2d51d.

Change-Id: Ifa5b82ca3b83d0ba481aa7a062827bd8e838989a
(cherry picked from commit e1b84a398766bdbccf2d834364fc9e9a7547bb4a)

The change involves stricter linkage between compute nodes, service records, and instances. A status check has been added, which should pass once the schema *and* online data migrations have been completed.

commit_message:
Align iRMC driver with Ironic's default boot_mode

This commit modifies iRMC driver to use ironic.conf [deploy]
default_boot_mode as default value of boot_mode.
Before this commit, iRMC driver assumes Legacy BIOS as default
boot_mode and value of default_boot_mode doesn't have any effect
on iRMC driver's behavior.

Story: 2010381
Task: 46643
Change-Id: Ic5a235785a1a2bb37fef38bd3a86f40125acb3d9
(cherry picked from commit 071cf9b2dd2233509c3cdb8261c0ee7b391e6b2c)
(cherry picked from commit 517a8b421c4e6147d2a0cc63415e926828770cd5)

commit_message:
Disable dynamic motd message

Right now default cloud images of Ubuntu does contain dynamic MOTD
by default, that takes around extra 0.4 sec for establishing connection.

Disabiling MOTD should improve responsivness of hosts and speedup
ansible execution as well.

With that we're keeping static MOTD that has no impact on connection
speed.

Change-Id: Iaf25f6f444055cefd60dd2e3b4d5579f2a6fcdb1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ansible-hardening refs/changes/70/899370/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Sizing encrypted volumes

This feature will support retype/migrate unencrypted volumes to
encrypted type.

Change-Id: Ib9058b89fefaad100a8f98e606bf7d02f2d781da
Implements: blueprint sizing-encrypted-volumes
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder-specs refs/changes/91/749991/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ======================== Sizing encrypted volumes ======================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/sizing-encrypted-volumes Problem description =================== If you have an unencrypted volume and migrate to an encrypted type, it fails because there isn't enough space on the target to fit the entire source volume. This happens because an encrypted volume must have a header, which takes up some space. In fact, the exact amount of space lost isn't clear, it may vary by luks (rbd) format and also iscsi (cryptsetup). It's probably on the order of 1-2 MB, but we allocate space in GB. Whether you can do really fine-grained space allocation or not probably depends on the backend containing the volume. However, we also need to keep the gigabyte boundaries for accounting purposes (usage, quotas, charges, etc.) because that's what everyone's tooling expects. In addition, drivers optimize migration in different ways, and since we previously didn't have a new size parameter, there's no easy way to get this info into the drivers. Taking everything into consideration, we could have a flag indicating that it's OK for the volume to be increased in size if it's required for the retype to succeed. This way we don't go behind the user's back -- we fail if the volume won't fit, and allow them to retype to a new size if they want the retype to succeed. Use Cases ========= The main use-case here is when upgrading an old deployment and would like to encrypt old volumes after that. Proposed change =============== * The manager.py will create a destination volume with <source-volume-size+1> GB size. After that *every driver* should manage the migration in their own way. * RPC minor version for a new param 3.x - Add migration_size to retype method and new_size to migrate method. * Add the next parameters to Python-cinderclient for retype and migrate commands: - Retype: New flag '--migration-size' indicating that it's OK for the volume to be increased in size if it's required for the retype to succeed. section:: Optional Arguments: --migration-size <never|on-demand> Increased volume size during migration. This argument is recommended when retyping to an encryption type. ... - Migration: allow a new size to be specified during a volume migration. New optional argument added '--new-size'. section:: Optional Arguments: --new-size [<size>] New size of volume, in GiBs. This is recommended when migrating to an encrypted host. ... * The displayed size of the volume should be the actual size of the volume. Alternatives ------------ Leave everything as-is and don’t allow this kind of migration. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- New parameter should be passes to retype and migrate. Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Sofia Enriquez <lsofia.enriquez@gmail.com> Work Items ---------- * Implement new logic in cinder * Implement new logic in python-cinderclient * Unit-tests * Tempest tests Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Unit tests and current devstack-based jobs won’t be enough to test these changes. At least two tests should be added to cinder_tempest_plugin/api/volume/admin/test_volume_retype.py 1. retype unencrypted volume to LUKS type. 2. retype encrypted LUKS volume to regular type. Documentation Impact ==================== Currently I’ve added some documentation notes warning about retyping an unencrypted/encrypted volume. However, these notes should be replaced with proper documentation. Notes to be removed - https://review.opendev.org/#/c/732988/ - https://review.opendev.org/#/c/745199/ References ========== * https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/sizing-encrypted-volumes * Victoria Mid Cycle https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/CinderVictoriaMidCycleSummary#Sizing_encrypted_volumes_.28continued.29 * Victoria PTG https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/CinderVictoriaPTGSummary#Sizing_encrypted_volumes

commit_message:
Use internal endpoint for barbican API

Nova defaults to using public endpoint for Barbican API which would
require internet access from the compute node so change this to
use the internal API endpoint.

Change-Id: Iaa14a9bf80d2e02197e74d67e812afc518fe1b65
(cherry picked from commit 7f431ebcda478e023d7cf173ed43cc08b648bb3b)

commit_message:
Add coreutils as valid value to fix KillFilter test

In containerized RHEL 9 environment the KillFilter test started to fail
because `os.readlink("/proc/<pid-of-cat/exe>")` return /usr/bin/coreutils.

Indeed cat is part of the coreutils package and the symlink of
this file point toward coreutils. Fixing this bug by adding
coreutils as a possible returned value for our tests.

Closes-Bug: #2037383
Change-Id: I141eb15efa30c7df3ca5419b594097f4b683663c
(cherry picked from commit 43ab5ad7a7e6ad8aa17e7abe5957bfe15cc043ac)

commit_message:
[EVPN] Add dynamic ASN lookup and fix route deletion

By setting the as to dynamic it is now possible to use the AS option set in the agent config. This makes failover possible when using eBGP internally.

Change-Id: Ic4801909b5d74dcf62c3c5811a556a34b09475ad
Signed-off-by: Justin Lamp <justin.lamp@netways.de>

commit_message:
Disable GSSAPIAuthentication for SSH

This implements STIG V-204598 [1] and disables
GSSAPIAuthentication that is enabled by default on EL
systems.
This also should speedup deployments on such systems, as
enabled GSSAPIAuthentication requires some time while
initiating connection.

[1] https://www.stigviewer.com/stig/red_hat_enterprise_linux_7/2020-12-08/finding/V-204598

Change-Id: I2d92541ccfc27e91224fd481c3792993428a052e

commit_message:
Align iRMC driver with Ironic's default boot_mode

This commit modifies iRMC driver to use ironic.conf [deploy]
default_boot_mode as default value of boot_mode.
Before this commit, iRMC driver assumes Legacy BIOS as default
boot_mode and value of default_boot_mode doesn't have any effect
on iRMC driver's behavior.

Story: 2010381
Task: 46643
Change-Id: Ic5a235785a1a2bb37fef38bd3a86f40125acb3d9
(cherry picked from commit 071cf9b2dd2233509c3cdb8261c0ee7b391e6b2c)

commit_message:
Add quorum queues support for service

This change implements and enables by default quorum support
for rabbitmq as well as providing default variables to globally tune
it's behaviour.

In order to ensure upgrade path and ability to switch back to HA queues
we change vhost names with removing leading `/`, as enabling quorum
requires to remove exchange which is tricky thing to do with running
services.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible-plugins/+/896017
Change-Id: I0f6ae74be36c0cb7a2270cfa1085c44e6dd4dc77
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_ironic refs/changes/09/898909/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
